=============================================================

The public ID above refers to the latest version of this DTD. To refer to this specific version, you may use this value: PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.3 BookMap//EN"

============================================================= HEADER ============================================================= MODULE: DITA Bookmap VERSION: 1.2 DATE: November 2009
=============================================================
============================================================= PUBLIC DOCUMENT TYPE DEFINITION TYPICAL INVOCATION
Refer to this file by the following public identifier or an appropriate system identifier PUBLIC "-//OASIS//ELEMENTS DITA BookMap//EN" Delivered as file "bookmap.mod"
============================================================= SYSTEM: Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA)
PURPOSE: Define elements and specialization atttributes for Book Maps
ORIGINAL CREATION DATE: March 2004
(C) Copyright OASIS Open 2005, 2009. (C) Copyright IBM Corporation 2004, 2005. All Rights Reserved. UPDATES: 2007.12.01 EK: Reformatted DTD modules for DITA 1.2 2008.01.28 RDA: Removed enumerations for attributes: publishtype/@value, bookrestriction/@value 2008.01.28 RDA: Added <metadata> to <bookmeta> 2008.01.30 RDA: Replace @conref defn. with %conref-atts; 2008.02.01 RDA: Added keys attributes, more keyref attrs 2008.02.12 RDA: Add keyword to many data specializations 2008.02.12 RDA: Add @format, @scope, and @type to publisherinformation 2008.02.13 RDA: Create .content and .attributes entities 2008.03.17 RDA: Add appendices element =============================================================

element.name: bookmap
element.documentation: The <bookmap> element is a map file used to organize DITA content into a traditional book format. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookmap> element is a map specialization used to describe the relationships among a set of DITA topics intended to be configured as a traditional book. Bookmaps consist of references to topics organized as book content. The topic references therefore are labeled according to the book components they point to, such as book title, front matter, chapter, and appendix.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: bookmeta
element.documentation: The <bookmeta> element contains information about the book that is not considered book content, such as copyright information, author information, and any classifications. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookmeta> element contains information about the book that is not considered book content, such as copyright information, author information, and any classifications.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: frontmatter
element.documentation: The <frontmatter> element contains the material that precedes the main body of a document. It may include items such as an abstract, a preface, and various types of book lists such as a <toc>, <tablelist>, or <figurelist>. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <frontmatter> element contains the material that precedes the main body of a document. It may include items such as an abstract, a preface, and various types of book lists such as a <toc>, <tablelist>, or <figurelist>.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: backmatter
element.documentation: The <backmatter> element contains the material that follows the main body of a document and any appendixes. It may include items such as a colophon, legal notices, and various types of book lists such as a glossary or an index. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <backmatter> element contains the material that follows the main body of a document and any appendices. It may include items such as a colophon, legal notices, and various types of book lists such as a glossary or an index.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: publisherinformation
element.documentation: The <publisherinformation> contains information about what group or person published the book, where it was published, and certain details about its publication history. Other publication history information is found in the <bookchangehistory> element. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <publisherinformation> contains information about what group or person published the book, where it was published, and certain details about its publication history. Other publication history information is found in the <bookchangehistory> element.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: person
element.documentation: The <person> element contains information about the name of a person. Note that unlike the <personname> element, the <person> element is not restricted to describing the names of authors. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <person> element contains information about the name of a person. Note that unlike the <personname> element, the <person> element is not restricted to describing the names of authors.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: organization
element.documentation: The <organization> element contains the name of an organization. Note that unlike <organizationname>, the <organization> element is not restricted to usage within <authorinformation>; it does not have to contain the name of an authoring organization. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <organization> element contains the name of an organization. Note that unlike <organizationname>, the <organization> element is not restricted to use within <authorinformation>; it does not have to contain the name of an authoring organization.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookchangehistory
element.documentation: The <bookchangehistory> element contains information about the history of the book's creation and publishing lifecycle, who wrote, reviewed, edited, and tested the book, and when these events took place. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookchangehistory> element contains information about the history of the book's creation and publishing lifecycle, including who wrote, reviewed, edited, and tested the book. It also specifies when these events took place.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookid
element.documentation: The <bookid> element contains the publisher's identification information for the book, such as part number, edition number and ISBN number. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookid> element contains the publisher's identification information for the book, such as part number, edition number and ISBN number.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: summary
element.documentation: The <summary> element contains a text summary associated with a book event (such as <approved> or <reviewed>) or with the list of copyrights for the book. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <summary> element contains a text summary associated with a book event (such as <approved> or <reviewed>) or with the list of copyrights for the book.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: printlocation
element.documentation: The <printlocation> element indicates the location where the book was printed. Customarily, the content is restricted to the name of the country. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <printlocation> element indicates the location where the book was printed. Customarily, the content is restricted to the name of the country.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: published
element.documentation: The <published> element contains information about the person or organization publishing the book, the dates when it was started and completed, and any special restrictions associated with it. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <published> element contains information about the person or organization publishing the book, the dates when it was started and completed, and any special restrictions associated with it.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: publishtype
element.documentation: The <publishtype> element indicates whether the book is generally available or is restricted in some way. The value attribute indicates the restrictions. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <publishtype> element indicates whether the book is generally available from the publisher or is restricted in some way. The @value attribute indicates the restrictions, such as beta release, limited availability, or general availability.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: revisionid
element.documentation: The <revisionid> element indicates the revision number or revision ID of the book. The processing implementation determines how the level is displayed. Common methods include using a dash, for example "-01". or a period, such as ".01". Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <revisionid> element indicates the revision number or revision ID of the book. The processing implementation determines how the level is displayed. Common methods include using a dash, for example "-01", or a period, such as ".01".
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: started
element.documentation: The <started> element indicates a start date for some type of book event, such as a review, editing, or testing. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <started> element indicates a start date for some type of book event, such as a review, editing, or testing.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: completed
element.documentation: The <completed> element indicates a completion date for some type of book event, such as a review, editing, or testing. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <completed> element indicates a completion date for some type of book event, such as a review, editing, or testing.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: year
element.documentation: The <year> element denotes a year. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <year> element denotes a year.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: month
element.documentation: The <month> element denotes a month of the year. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <month> element denotes a month of the year.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: day
element.documentation: The <day> element denotes a day of the month. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <day> element denotes a day of the month.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: reviewed
element.documentation: The <reviewed> element contains information about when and by whom the book was reviewed during its publication history. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <reviewed> element contains information about when and by whom the book was reviewed during its publication history.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: edited
element.documentation: The <edited> element contains information about when and by whom the book was edited during its publication history. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <edited> element contains information about when and by whom the book was edited during its publication history.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: tested
element.documentation: The <tested> element contains information about when and by whom the book was tested during its publication history. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <tested> element contains information about when and by whom the book was tested during its publication history.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: approved
element.documentation: The <approved> element contains information about when and by whom the book was approved during its publication history. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <approved> element contains information about when and by whom the book was approved during its publication history.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookevent
element.documentation: The <bookevent> element indicates a general event in the publication history of a book. This is an appropriate element for specialization if the current set of specific book event types, that is, review, edit, test or approval, does not meed your needs. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookevent> element indicates a general event in the publication history of a book. This is an appropriate element for specialization if the current set of specific book event types does not meet your needs. If an element already exists to describe a specific type of event, such as <reviewed>, <edited>, or <approved>, that element should be used instead.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookeventtype
element.documentation: The <bookeventtype> element indicates the specific nature of a <bookevent>, such as updated, indexed, or deprecated. The required name attribute indicates the event's type. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookpartno
element.documentation: The <bookpartno> element contains the book's part number; such as 99F1234. This is generally the number that the publisher uses to identify the book for tracking purposes. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookpartno> element contains the book's part number, such as 99F1234. A publisher may use a number like this one to identify a book for tracking purposes.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: edition
element.documentation: The <edition> element contains the edition number information, such as First Edition, or Third Edition, used by a publisher to identify a book. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <edition> element contains the edition number information, such as First Edition, or Third Edition, used by a publisher to identify a book.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: isbn
element.documentation: The <isbn> element contains the book's International Standard Book Number (ISBN). Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <isbn> element contains the book's International Standard Book Number (ISBN).
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: booknumber
element.documentation: The <booknumber> element contains the book's form number, such as SC21-1920. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <booknumber> element contains the book's form number, such as SC21-1920.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: volume
element.documentation: The <volume> element contains the book's volume number, such as Volume 2. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <volume> element contains the book's volume number, such as "2" to represent Volume 2.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: maintainer
element.documentation: The <maintainer> element contains information about who maiintains the document; this can be an organization or a person. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <maintainer> element contains information about who maintains the document; the maintainer may be an organization or a person.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookrights
element.documentation: The <bookrights> element contains the information about the legal rights associated with the book, including copyright dates and owners. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookrights> element contains the information about the legal rights associated with the book, including copyright dates and owners.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: copyrfirst
element.documentation: The <copyfirst> element contains the first copyright year within a multiyear copyright statement. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <copyrfirst> element contains the copyright year, or the first copyright year within a multiyear copyright statement.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: copyrlast
element.documentation: The <copylast> element contains the last copyright year within a multiyear copyright statement. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <copyrlast> element contains the last copyright year within a multiyear copyright statement.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookowner
element.documentation: The <bookowner> element contains the owner of the copyright. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookowner> element specifies the owner of the book's copyright.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: bookrestriction
element.documentation: The <bookrestriction> element indicates whether the book is classified, or restricted in some way. The value attribute indicates the restrictions; this may be a string like "All Rights Reserved," representing the publisher's copyright restrictions. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookrestriction> element indicates whether the book is classified or restricted in some way. The @value attribute indicates any restrictions on the use of the material, such as declaring the information confidential or for licensed use only.
Category: Bookmap metadata elements

element.name: booktitle
element.documentation: The <booktitle> element contains the title information for a book. , including <booklibrary> data, a <maintitle> and subtitle (<titlealt>) as required. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <booktitle> element contains the title information for a book, including the library title, main title, subtitle, and other titles (as required).
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: booklibrary
element.documentation: The <booklibrary> element contains the library information for a book. Library entries contain information about the series, library, or collection of documents to which the book belongs. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <booklibrary> element contains the library information for a book. Library entries contain information about the series, library, or collection of documents to which the book belongs.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: mainbooktitle
element.documentation: The <mainbooktitle> element contains the primary title information for a book. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <mainbooktitle> element contains the primary title information for a book.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: booktitlealt
element.documentation: The <booktitlealt> element contains the alternative title, subtitle, or short title for a book. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <booktitlealt> element contains the alternative title, subtitle, or short title for a book. It may be specialized into a specific element for those or other purposes.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: draftintro
element.documentation: The <draftintro> element references a topic used as an introduction to the draft of this book. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <draftintro> element references a topic used as an introduction to the draft of this book.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: bookabstract
element.documentation: The <bookabstract> element references a topic used within a bookmap as a brief summary of book content, generally output as part of the book's front matter. It is used to help the reader quickly evaluate the book's purpose. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bookabstract> element references a topic used within a bookmap as a brief summary of book content, generally output as part of the book's front matter. It is used to help the reader quickly evaluate the book's purpose.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: dedication
element.documentation: The <dedication> element references a topic containing a dedication for the book, such as to a person or group. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <dedication> element references a topic containing a dedication for the book, such as to a person or group.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: preface
element.documentation: The <preface> element references introductory information about a book, such as the purpose and structure of the document. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <preface> element references a topic or map containing introductory information about a book, such as the purpose and structure of the document.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: chapter
element.documentation: The <chapter> element references a topic as a chapter within a book. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <chapter> element references a topic or map as a chapter within a book.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: part
element.documentation: The <part> element references a part topic for the book. A new part is started. Use <part> to divide a document's chapters into logical groupings. For example, in a document that contains both guide and reference information, you can define two parts, one containing the guide information and the other containing the reference information. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <part> element references a part topic or a map that references part topics for the book. Use <part> to divide a document's chapters into logical groupings. For example, in a document that contains both guide and reference information, you can define two parts, one containing the guide information and the other containing the reference information.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: appendix
element.documentation: The <appendix> element references a topic as a appendix within a book. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <appendix> element references a topic as a appendix within a book.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: appendices
element.documentation: The <appendices> element is an optional wrapper for <appendix> elements within a bookmap.

body.p: The <appendices> element is an optional wrapper for <appendix> elements within a bookmap.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: notices
element.documentation: The <notices> element references special notice information, for example, legal notices about supplementary copyrights and trademarks associated with the book. . Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <notices> element references a topic containing special notice information, for example, legal notices about supplementary copyrights and trademarks associated with the book.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: amendments
element.documentation: The <amendments> element references a list of amendments or updates to the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants an amendments list generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <amendments> element references a list of amendments or updates to the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants an amendments list generated at the particular location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: colophon
element.documentation: The <colophon> element references a topic describing how this document was created. In publishing, a colophon describes details of the production of a book. This information generally includes the typefaces used, and often the names of their designers; the paper, ink and details of the binding materials and methods may also receive mention. In the case of technical books, a colophon may specify the software used to prepare the text and diagrams for publication. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <colophon> element references a topic describing how this document was created. In publishing, a colophon describes details of the production of a book. This information generally includes the typefaces used, and often the names of their designers; the paper, ink and details of the binding materials and methods may also receive mention. In the case of technical books, a colophon may specify the software used to prepare the text and diagrams for publication. The <colophon> may appear in the <frontmatter> or <backmatter>.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: booklists
element.documentation: The <booklists> element references lists of various kinds within the book. For example, it can be used within front matter to reference a <toc>, <tablelist>, and <figurelist>, or within back matter to reference a <glossarylist>, <indexlist>, and <abbrevlist>. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants the lists generated at the <booklists> location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <booklists> element references lists of various kinds within the book. For example, it can be used within <frontmatter> to reference a <toc>, <tablelist>, and <figurelist>, or within <backmatter> to reference a <glossarylist>, <indexlist>, and <abbrevlist>. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants the lists generated at the <booklists> location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: toc
element.documentation: The <toc> element references the table of contents within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a table of contents generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <toc> element indicates to the processing software that the author wants a table of contents generated at the particular location. If no @href attribute is specified on the <toc> element, an external processor may generate table of contents at this location. If the @href attribute references a topic or map, that topic or map should contain a manually created table of contents.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: figurelist
element.documentation: The <figurelist> element references a list of figures in the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a list of figures generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <figurelist> element references a topic containing a list of figures in the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a list of figures generated at the particular location. If no @href attribute is specified on the <figurelist> element, an external processor may generate a list of figures at this location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: tablelist
element.documentation: The <tablelist> element references a list of tables within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a list of tables generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <tablelist> element references a topic that contains a list of tables within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a list of tables generated at the particular location. If no @href attribute is specified on the <tablelist> element, an external processor may generate a list of tables at this location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: abbrevlist
element.documentation: The <abbrevlist> element references a list of abbreviations. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants an abbreviation list generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <abbrevlist> element references a list of abbreviations. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants an abbreviation list generated at the particular location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: trademarklist
element.documentation: The <trademarklist> element references a list of trademarks within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a list of trademarks generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <trademarklist> element references a topic that contains a list of trademarks within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a list of trademarks generated at the particular location. If no @href attribute is specified on the <trademarklist> element, an external processor may generate a list of trademarks at this location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: bibliolist
element.documentation: The <bibliolist> element references a list of bibliographic entries within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a bibliography, containing links to related books, articles, published papers, or other types of material, generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <bibliolist> element references a topic containing a list of bibliographic entries within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a bibliography, containing links to related books, articles, published papers, or other types of material, generated at the particular location. If no @href attribute is specified on the <bibliolist> element, an external processor may generate a list of bibliographic entries at this location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: glossarylist
element.documentation: The <glossarylist> element references a list of glossary entries within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a glossary list generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <glossarylist> element references a list of glossary entries within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants a glossary list generated at the particular location.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: indexlist
element.documentation: The <indexlist> element lists the index entries in the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants an index generated at the particular location. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <indexlist> element indicates to the processing software that the author wants an index at the particular location. If no @href attribute is specified on the <indexlist> element, an external processor may generate an index at this location. If the @href attribute references a topic or map, that topic or map should contain a manually created index.
Category: Bookmap content elements

element.name: booklist
element.documentation: The <booklist> element is a general purpose element, designed for use in specializations, that references a list of particular types of topics within the book. It indicates to the processing software that the author wants that list of topics generated at the particular location. For example, it could be used in a specialization to reference the location of a list of program listings or of authors of topics. Category: Bookmap elements

body.p: The <booklist> element is a general purpose element, designed for use in specializations, that references a topic or map containing a list of items within the book. For example, it could be used to reference a topic that contains a list of authors for the book. When a more specific element is already available, such as <tablelist> for a list of tables, that element should be used instead.
Category: Bookmap content elements

moduleDesc.headerComment:
============================================================= HEADER ============================================================= MODULE: DITA learningSummary VERSION: 1.2 DATE: November 2009
=============================================================
============================================================= PUBLIC DOCUMENT TYPE DEFINITION TYPICAL INVOCATION
Refer to this file by the following public identfier or an appropriate system identifier PUBLIC "-//OASIS//ELEMENTS DITA Learning Summary//EN" Delivered as file "learningSummary.mod
============================================================= SYSTEM: Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA)
PURPOSE: Declaring the elements and specialization attributes for Learning Summary
ORIGINAL CREATION DATE: May 2007
(C) Copyright OASIS Open 2007, 2009 All Rights Reserved. =============================================================

element.name: learningSummary
element.documentation: A Learning Summary recaps and provides context for the achievement or accomplishment of learning objectives, provides guidance to reinforce learning and long-term memory, and may pose questions to enhance encoding and verification of the learning content.

body.p: A Learning Summary topic recaps and provides context for the achievement or accomplishment of learning objectives, provides guidance to reinforce learning and long-term memory, and may pose questions to enhance encoding and verification of the learning content.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

element.name: learningSummarybody
element.documentation: The <learningSummarybody> element is the main body-level element in a learningSummary topic.

body.p: The <learningSummarybody> element is the main body-level element in a <learningSummary> topic.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

============================================================= HEADER ============================================================= MODULE: DITA learningPlan VERSION: 1.2 DATE: November 2009
=============================================================
============================================================= PUBLIC DOCUMENT TYPE DEFINITION TYPICAL INVOCATION
Refer to this file by the following public identfier or an appropriate system identifier PUBLIC "-//OASIS//ELEMENTS DITA Learning Plan//EN" Delivered as file "learningPlan.mod
============================================================= SYSTEM: Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA)
PURPOSE: Declaring the elements and specialization attributes for Learning Plan
ORIGINAL CREATION DATE: May 2007
(C) Copyright OASIS Open 2007, 2009. All Rights Reserved. =============================================================

element.name: learningPlan
element.documentation: A Learning Plan topic describes learning needs and goals, instructional design models, task analyses, learning taxonomies, and other information necessary to the lesson planning process.

body.p: A Learning Plan topic describes learning needs and goals, instructional design models, task analyses, learning taxonomies, and other information necessary to the lesson planning process.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

element.name: learningPlanbody
element.documentation: The <learningPlanbody> element is the main body-level element in a learningPlan topic.

body.p: The <learningPlanbody> element is the main body-level element in a <learningPlan> topic.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

element.name: lcProject
element.documentation: The <lcProject> provides learning content project plan description information.

body.p: The <lcProject> provides learning content project plan description information.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcClient
element.documentation: The <lcPlanTitle> provides a title for this plan.

body.p: The <lcClient> provides the person or organization sponsoring or requiring the learning event development.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlanTitle
element.documentation: The <lcPlanTitle> provides a title for this plan.

body.p: The <lcPlanTitle> provides a title for a specific module, lesson, or section of the course that this plan describes.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcCIN
element.documentation: The <lcCIN> provides an alternate identifier for the project title.

body.p: The <lcCIN> provides a course identification number or other alternate identifier for the project title.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcModDate
element.documentation: The <lcModDate> provides the project modification date.

body.p: The <lcModDate> provides the project modification date.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcDelivDate
element.documentation: The <lcDelivDate> provides the project delivery date.

body.p: The <lcDelivDate> provides the project delivery date.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlanSubject
element.documentation: The <lcPlanSubject> provides a complete description of the subject of the planned learning.

body.p: The <lcPlanSubject> provides a complete description of the subject of the planned learning.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlanDescrip
element.documentation: The <lcPlanDescrip> provides a plan description.

body.p: The <lcPlanDescrip> provides a plan description.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlanPrereqs
element.documentation: <lcPlanPrereqs> provides the knowledge, skills, abilities, courses and other activities learners must have satisfied to take the instruction.

body.p: The <lcPlanPrereqs> element provides the knowledge, skills, abilities, courses and other activities learners must have satisfied to take the instruction.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcNeedsAnalysis
element.documentation: The <lcNeedsAnalysis> describes the training requirement and identifies the need to develop or revise content. These include periodic training gap analyses, changes to operational or maintenance requirements, and changes to equipment or systems.

body.p: The <lcNeedsAnalysis> describes the training requirement and identifies the need to develop or revise content. These include periodic training gap analyses, changes to operational or maintenance requirements, and changes to equipment or systems.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcOrganizational
element.documentation: The <lcOrganizational> describes an organization's learning requirements.

body.p: The <lcOrganizational> describes an organization's learning requirements.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcGeneralDescription
element.documentation: The <lcGeneralDescription> provides a space to develop a general description about the organization's training needs.

body.p: The <lcGeneralDescription> provides a space to develop a general description about the organization's training needs.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcGoals
element.documentation: The <lcGoals> provides the outcomes desired by the organization to be addressed by the training effort. These goals may require concurrent efforts outside of training such as technology acquisition, reorganization, and so forth.

body.p: The <lcGoals> provides the outcomes desired by the organization to be addressed by the training effort. These goals may require concurrent efforts outside of training such as technology acquisition, reorganization, and so forth.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcNeeds
element.documentation: The <lcNeeds> provides the needs behind the outcomes described by the <lcGoals>.

body.p: The <lcNeeds> provides the needs behind the outcomes described by the <lcGoals>.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcValues
element.documentation: The <lcValues> describes affective components of desired instructional outcomes.

body.p: The <lcValues> describes affective components of desired instructional outcomes.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcOrgConstraints
element.documentation: The <lcOrgConstraints> provides organizational aspects that may limit the organization's ability to effectively use the instruction to meet its goals.

body.p: The <lcOrgConstraints> provides organizational aspects that may limit the organization's ability to effectively use the instruction to meet its goals.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlanAudience
element.documentation: The <lcPlanAudience> describes characteristics of the learners who take the instruction.

body.p: The <lcPlanAudience> describes characteristics of the learners who take the instruction.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcEdLevel
element.documentation: The <lcEdLevel> provides the range of learners' education level and the relevancy to the learning plan.

body.p: The <lcEdLevel> provides the range of learners' education level and the relevancy to the learning plan.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcAge
element.documentation: The <lcAge> provides the age range of the intended learner audience, for use by curriculum developers and course planners.

body.p: The <lcAge> provides the age range of the intended learner audience, for use by curriculum developers and course planners.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcBackground
element.documentation: The <lcBackground> provides the learners' professional background and the relevancy to the learning plan.

body.p: The <lcBackground> provides the learners' professional background and the relevancy to the learning plan.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcSkills
element.documentation: The <lcSkills> describes the learners' current skill set and the relevancy to the learning plan.

body.p: The <lcSkills> describes the learners' current skill set and the relevancy to the broader plan audience or a specific task in the plan.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcKnowledge
element.documentation: <lcKnowledge> provides the learners' current knowledge of the learning topics.

body.p: The <lcKnowledge> element describes the learner's current knowledge and the relevancy to the broader plan audience or a specific task in the plan.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcMotivation
element.documentation: The <lcMotivation> provides the reasons why the learners want and/or need to take the instruction.

body.p: The <lcMotivation> provides the reasons why the learners want and/or need to take the instruction.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcSpecChars
element.documentation: The <lcSpecChars> provides learner characteristics specific to the population that will influence the design, including learning disabilities, physical handicaps, and so forth.

body.p: The <lcSpecChars> provides learner characteristics specific to the population that will influence the design, including learning disabilities, physical handicaps, and so forth.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcWorkEnv
element.documentation: The <lcWorkEnv> describes the working conditions and contexts in which the training will be applied.

body.p: The <lcWorkEnv> describes the working conditions and contexts in which the training will be applied.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcWorkEnvDescription
element.documentation: The <lcWorkEnvDescription> provides the general working environment in which the training will be applied.

body.p: The <lcWorkEnvDescription> provides the general working environment in which the training will be applied.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlanResources
element.documentation: The <lcPlanResources> describes resource needs.

body.p: The <lcPlanResources> describes resource needs.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcProcesses
element.documentation: The <lcProcesses> describes processes learners routinely follow.

body.p: The <lcProcesses> describes processes learners routinely follow.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcTask
element.documentation: The <lcTask> captures a work item to be performed, as part of the learning plan.

body.p: The <lcTask> captures a work item to be performed, as part of the learning plan.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcTaskItem
element.documentation: The <lcTaskItem> describes a discreet task to be taught.

body.p: The <lcTaskItem> describes a discreet task to be taught.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcAttitude
element.documentation: The <lcAttitude> describes mental state that influences the choices of personal actions.

body.p: The <lcAttitude> describes mental state that influences the choices of personal actions.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcGapAnalysis
element.documentation: The <lcGapAnalysis> compares existing learning objectives to current job task analysis.

body.p: The <lcGapAnalysis> compares existing learning objectives to current job task analysis.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcGapItem
element.documentation: The <lcGapItem> describes gaps between existing training objectives and related job-task-analysis content.

body.p: The <lcGapItem> describes gaps between existing training objectives and related job-task-analysis content.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlanObjective
element.documentation: The <lcPlanObjective> describes the objective to be addressed by a gap analysis or intervention.

body.p: The <lcPlanObjective> describes the objective to be addressed by a gap analysis or intervention.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcJtaItem
element.documentation: The <lcJtaItem> provides description of job task analysis (JTA) as related to a particular learning objective.

body.p: The <lcJtaItem> provides description of job task analysis (JTA) as related to a particular learning objective.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcGapItemDelta
element.documentation: The <lcGapItemDelta> describes the gap between the learning objective and the task analysis.

body.p: The <lcGapItemDelta> describes the gap between the learning objective and the task analysis.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcIntervention
element.documentation: The <lcIntervention> describes the approach and strategies to building the learning materials, based on the needs analysis.

body.p: The <lcIntervention> describes the approach and strategies to building the learning materials, based on the needs analysis.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcInterventionItem
element.documentation: The <lcInterventionItem> describes how learning content is built, based on a systems approach to analyzing, designing, developing, implementing, and evaluating any instructional experience.

body.p: The <lcInterventionItem> describes how learning content is built, based on a systems approach to analyzing, designing, developing, implementing, and evaluating any instructional experience.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcLearnStrat
element.documentation: The <lcLearnStrat> describes the manner in which the learning content will be instructed. This should be a high level design that applies instructional-design theories and models.

body.p: The <lcLearnStrat> describes the manner in which the learning content will be instructed. This should be a high level design that applies instructional-design theories and models.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcAssessment
element.documentation: The <lcAssessment> describes assessment plans.

body.p: The <lcAssessment> describes assessment plans.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcDelivery
element.documentation: The <lcDelivery> describes the delivery method for this learning content.

body.p: The <lcDelivery> describes the delivery method for this learning content.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcTechnical
element.documentation: The <lcTechnical> describes the technical requirements to the learning content and how those requirements are supported by the instructional design.

body.p: The <lcTechnical> describes the technical requirements to the learning content and how those requirements are supported by the instructional design.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcLMS
element.documentation: The <lcLMS> provides the LMS name and version number used in the learning event.

body.p: The <lcLMS> provides the LMS name and version number used in the learning event.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcNoLMS
element.documentation: Use <lcNoLMS> when you plan to deliver the content as a standalone package, without a learning management system (LMS).

body.p: Use <lcNoLMS> when you plan to deliver the content as a standalone package, without a learning management system (LMS).
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcHandouts
element.documentation: The <lcHandouts> provides aspects of the course that are provided by the instructor in support of the course learning objectives.

body.p: The <lcHandouts> provides aspects of the course that are provided by the instructor in support of the course learning objectives.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcClassroom
element.documentation: The <lcClassroom> describes the classroom environment.

body.p: The <lcClassroom> describes the classroom environment.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcOJT
element.documentation: The <lcOJT> is "the job training" and describes aspects of the course taking place in the work environment.

body.p: The <lcOJT> is "the on-the-job training" and describes aspects of the course taking place in the work environment.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcConstraints
element.documentation: The <lcConstraints> describes the organizational or technical aspects that may limit the organization's ability to effectively use the instruction to meet its goals.

body.p: The <lcConstraints> describes the organizational or technical aspects that may limit the organization's ability to effectively use the instruction to meet its goals.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcW3C
element.documentation: The <lcW3C> provides requirements for use of world wide web consortium standards.

body.p: The <lcW3C> provides requirements for use of world wide web consortium standards.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPlayers
element.documentation: The <lcPlayers> describes tools and plugins used for time-sequenced display at runtime.

body.p: The <lcPlayers> describes tools and plugins used for time-sequenced display at runtime.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcGraphics
element.documentation: The <lcGraphics> describes standards and system requirements for displaying graphics and other related content types.

body.p: The <lcGraphics> describes standards and system requirements for displaying graphics and other related content types.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcViewers
element.documentation: The <lcViewers> describes viewers used for time-sequenced display at runtime.

body.p: The <lcViewers> describes viewers used for time-sequenced display at runtime.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcResolution
element.documentation: The <lcResolution> describes the required computer screen resolution for the online instruction.

body.p: The <lcResolution> describes the required computer screen resolution for the online instruction.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcFileSizeLimitations
element.documentation: The <lcFileSizeLimitations> describes any file size limitation in the download environment.

body.p: The <lcFileSizeLimitations> describes any file size limitation in the download environment.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcDownloadTime
element.documentation: The <lcDownloadTime> describes the maximum time allowed for download time in the client's delivery environment.

body.p: The <lcDownloadTime> describes the maximum time allowed for download time in the client's delivery environment.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcSecurity
element.documentation: The <lcSecurity> describes the security requirements in the delivered instruction.

body.p: The <lcSecurity> describes the security requirements in the delivered instruction.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

Category: Top level interactions elements

=============================================================
============================================================= PUBLIC DOCUMENT TYPE DEFINITION TYPICAL INVOCATION
Refer to this file by the following public identfier or an appropriate system identifier PUBLIC "-//OASIS//ELEMENTS DITA Learning Overview//EN" Delivered as file "learningOverview.mod
============================================================= SYSTEM: Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA)
PURPOSE: Declaring the elements and specialization attributes for Learning Overview
ORIGINAL CREATION DATE: May 2007
(C) Copyright OASIS Open 2007, 2009. All Rights Reserved. =============================================================

element.name: learningOverview
element.documentation: A Learning Overview topic identifies the learning objectives, includes other information helpful to the learner, such as prerequisites, duration, intended audience, and can include information and strategies that seeks to gain attention and stimulate recall of prior learning.

body.p: A Learning Overview topic identifies the learning objectives, includes other information helpful to the learner, such as prerequisites, duration, intended audience, and can include information and strategies that seeks to gain attention and stimulate recall of prior learning.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

element.name: learningOverviewbody
element.documentation: The <learningOverviewbody> element is the main body-level element in a learningOverview topic. A learningOverviewbody has a very specific structure, with the following elements in this order: <lcIntro>, <lcAudience>, <lcDuration>, <lcPrereqs>, <lcObjectives>, <lcResources>, followed by one or more <section> elements. Each of the learningOverviewbody sections are optional.

body.p: The <learningOverviewbody> element is the main body-level element in a <learningOverview> topic. A <learningOverviewbody> has a very specific structure, with the following elements in this order: <lcIntro>, <lcAudience>, <lcDuration>, <lcPrereqs>, <lcObjectives>, <lcResources>, followed by zero or more <section> elements. Each of the <learningOverviewbody> sections are optional.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

=============================================================
============================================================= PUBLIC DOCUMENT TYPE DEFINITION TYPICAL INVOCATION

element.name: learningContent
element.documentation: A Learning Content topic provides the learning content itself, and enables direct use of content from DITA task, concept, and reference topics, as well as additional content of any topic type that supports specific objectives declared in the Learning Overview topic type. A Learning Content topic comprises a set of self-contained content about a single terminal learning objective supported by zero or more enabling learning objectives.

body.p: A Learning Content topic provides the learning content itself, and enables direct use of content from DITA task, concept, and reference topics, as well as additional content of any topic type that supports specific objectives declared in the Learning Overview topic type.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

element.name: learningContentbody
element.documentation: The <learningContentbody> element is the main body-level element in a learningContent topic.

body.p: The <learningContentbody> element is the main body-level element in a <learningContent> topic.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

body.p: Use a <learningObjectMap> to create standalone aggregations of <learningContent> together with its supporting plan, overview, summary, and assessments, according to the needs identified by the learning goals and objectives. The <learningObjectMap> references one and only one <learningObject>. Any <topicref> elements that occur before the <learningObject> are intended to be resource-only references such as key definitions.
Category: Learning and training: map types

============================================================= HEADER ============================================================= MODULE: DITA learningBase VERSION: 1.2 DATE: November 2009
=============================================================
============================================================= PUBLIC DOCUMENT TYPE DEFINITION TYPICAL INVOCATION
Refer to this file by the following public identfier or an appropriate system identifier PUBLIC "-//OASIS//ELEMENTS DITA Learning Base//EN" Delivered as file "learningBase.mod"
============================================================= SYSTEM: Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA)
PURPOSE: Declaring the elements and specialization attributes for Learning Base
ORIGINAL CREATION DATE: May 2007
(C) Copyright OASIS Open 2007, 2009. All Rights Reserved.
CHANGE LOG:
Sept 2009: WEK: Make learningBasebody optional per TC decision. =============================================================

element.name: learningBase
element.documentation: The learningBase topic type is not used to deliver any actual learning content, but instead provides a set of common elements for use in the other more specific learning content types: learningOverview,learningContent, learningSummary, learningAssessment, and learningPlan.

body.p: The <learningBase> topic type is not used to deliver any actual learning content, but instead provides a set of common elements for use in the other more specific learning content types: <learningOverview>, <learningContent>, <learningSummary>, <learningAssessment>, and <learningPlan>.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

element.name: learningBasebody
element.documentation: The <learningBasebody> element is the main body-level element in a learningBase topic. The learningBase topic provides a set of base elements for use in the other specialized learning types. It is not generally intended for creating actual content. As such, each of the body sections in learningBase are optional.

body.p: The <learningBasebody> element is the main body-level element in a <learningBase> topic. The <learningBase> topic provides a set of base elements for use in the other specialized learning types. It is not generally intended for creating actual content. As such, each of the body sections in <learningBase> are optional.
Category: Learning and training: topic elements

element.name: lcIntro
element.documentation: The <lcIntro> provides a detailed introduction and description of the content to be delivered, in cases where the <shortdesc> is not adequate to fully describe the content. It may also include instructor notes.

body.p: The <lcIntro> provides a detailed introduction and description of the content to be delivered, in cases where the <shortdesc> is not adequate to fully describe the content. It may also include instructor notes.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcObjectives
element.documentation: The <lcObjectives> lists or describes the learning goals.

body.p: The <lcObjectives> lists or describes the learning goals.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcObjectivesStem
element.documentation: The <lcObjectivesStem> provides a leading sentence to introduce a list of learning objectives.

body.p: The <lcObjectivesStem> provides a leading sentence to introduce a list of learning objectives.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcObjectivesGroup
element.documentation: The <lcObjectivesGroup> contains a list of one or more learning objectives.

body.p: The <lcObjectivesGroup> contains a list of one or more learning objectives.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcObjective
element.documentation: The <lcObjective> describes a single learning objective.

body.p: The <lcObjective> describes a single learning objective.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcAudience
element.documentation: The <lcAudience> describes characteristics of the learners who take the instruction.

body.p: The <lcAudience> describes characteristics of the learners who take the instruction.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcDuration
element.documentation: The <lcDuration> provides an estimated duration for the learning activity.

body.p: The <lcDuration> provides an estimated duration for the learning activity.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcTime
element.documentation: The <lcTime> specifies the time expected to complete an activity.

body.p: The <lcTime> specifies the time expected to complete an activity. You can specify the time both as text to display to the user and as an attribute value that follows a specific time format.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcPrereqs
element.documentation: The <lcPrereqs> describes the knowledge, experience, or other prerequisites needed to complete the content.

body.p: The <lcPrereqs> describes the knowledge, experience, or other prerequisites needed to complete the content.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcSummary
element.documentation: The <lcSummary> provides a textual summary that describes the main learning goals and lessons learned.

body.p: The <lcSummary> provides a textual summary that describes the main learning goals and lessons learned.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcNextSteps
element.documentation: The <lcNextSteps> suggests next steps to reinforce the knowledge learned.

body.p: The <lcNextSteps> suggests next steps to reinforce the knowledge learned.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcReview
element.documentation: The <lcReview> provides a review of the main points.

body.p: The <lcReview> provides a review of the main points.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcResources
element.documentation: The <lcResources> provides a list of related resources and information about them, such as related articles or samples on the web.

body.p: The <lcResources> provides a list of related resources and information about them, such as related articles or samples on the web.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcChallenge
element.documentation: The <lcChallenge> refers to what it is that you want the student to practice. For example, if you're studying network diagrams, and challenge might be "see if you can put this network into its proper sequence" or "see if you understand this network flow".

body.p: The <lcChallenge> refers to what it is that you want the student to practice. For example, if you're studying network diagrams, and challenge might be "see if you can put this network into its proper sequence" or "see if you understand this network flow".
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcInstruction
element.documentation: The <lcInstruction> describes the specifics of a learning activity.

body.p: The <lcInstruction> describes the specifics of a learning activity.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: lcInteraction
element.documentation: The <lcInteraction> is a wrapper element for all the interactions of the assessment. The interactions themselves are based on a basic set of assessment types implemented as a DITA domain specialization.

body.p: The <lcInteraction> is a wrapper element for all the interactions of the assessment. The interactions themselves are based on the <lcInteractionBase> type. A starter set of interaction types is defined in the learning domain.
Category: Learning and training: common content elements

element.name: learningGroup
element.documentation: learningGroup introduces and groups learning objects into higher-level organizations, such as course-level, module-level, or lesson-level.

body.p: Use a <learningGroup> to structure learning objects into higher-level organizations, such as course-level, module-level, or lesson-level.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

element.name: learningObject
element.documentation: learningObject organizes topic references to DITA learning topics as a learning object.

body.p: learningObject organizes topic references to DITA learning topics as a learning object.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

element.name: learningPlanRef
element.documentation: Use a learningPlanRef element to include a topic reference to a learning plan topic as part of a learningObject.

body.p: Use a <learningPlanRef> element to include a topic reference to a learning plan topic as part of a <learningObject>.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

element.name: learningOverviewRef
element.documentation: Use a learningOverviewRef element to include a topic reference to a learning overview topic as part of a learningObject.

body.p: Use a <learningOverviewRef> element to include a topic reference to a learning overview topic as part of a <learningObject> element.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

element.name: learningSummaryRef
element.documentation: Use a learningSummaryRef to include topic reference to a learning summary topic in a DITA learning object.

body.p: Use a <learningSummaryRef> to include topic reference to a learning summary topic in a DITA learning object.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

element.name: learningContentRef
element.documentation: Use a learningContentRef element to include a topic reference to a learning content topic as part of a DITA learningObject.

body.p: Use a <learningContentRef> element to include a topic reference to a learning content topic as part of a DITA <learningObject> element.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements
Use a <learningContentComponentRef> element to include a topic reference to a topic that acts as a subtopic of a <learningContent> topic.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

element.name: learningPreAssessmentRef
element.documentation: Use a learningPreAssessmentRef element to include a topic reference to a learning assessment topic as part of a DITA learningObject.

body.p: Use a <learningPreAssessmentRef> element to include a topic reference to a learning assessment topic as part of a DITA <learningObject>.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

element.name: learningPostAssessmentRef
element.documentation: Use a learningPostAssessmentRef element to include a topic reference to a learning assessment topic as part of a DITA learningObject.

body.p: Use a <learningPostAssessmentRef> element to include a topic reference to a learning assessment topic as part of a DITA <learningObject>.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements
Use a <learningGroupMapRef> element to include a map reference to a learning group map as part of a DITA learning map, learning bookmap, learning group map, or <learningGroup> element.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements
Use a <learningObjectMapRef> element to include a map reference to a learning object map as part of a DITA learning map, learning bookmap, or learning group map.
Category: Learning and training: map domain elements

body.p: The <lcInteractionBase> element was deprecated in DITA version 1.3. It was replaced with the <lcInteractionBase2> element. It was originally intended as the base for more specialized assessment types.
Category: Top level interactions elements (DEPRECATED)

The <lcQuestionBase> element was deprecated in DITA version 1.3. It was replaced with the <lcQuestionBase2> element. It was originally intended as the base for lcQuestion in the learningDomain domain. This is an "abstract" element type intended only for use as a base for specialization.
Category: Top level interactions elements (DEPRECATED)

(C) Copyright OASIS Open 2007, 2009. Scott Hudson - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

element.name: lcLom
element.documentation: The <lcLom> provides a set of specialized data elements to use to specify metadata in the learning topics and learning map domain.

body.p: The <lcLom> provides a set of specialized data elements to use to specify metadata in the learning topics and learning map domain.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomStructure
element.documentation: The <lomStructure> provides learning metadata about the underlying organizational structure of the resource.

body.p: The <lomStructure> provides learning metadata about the underlying organizational structure of the resource.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomCoverage
element.documentation: The <lomCoverage> provides learning metadata about the temporal or spatial characteristics of the content, such as historical context.

body.p: The <lomCoverage> provides learning metadata about the temporal or spatial characteristics of the content, such as historical context.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomAggregationLevel
element.documentation: The <lomAggregationLevel> describes the functional size of the learning resource.

body.p: The <lomAggregationLevel> describes the functional size of the learning resource.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomTechRequirement
element.documentation: The <lomTechRequirement> provides learning metadata about the operating system(s) under which the learning resource can run.

body.p: The <lomTechRequirement> provides learning metadata about the operating system(s) under which the learning resource can run.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomInstallationRemarks
element.documentation: The <lomInstallationRemarks> provides learning metadata about how to install and needed resources.

body.p: The <lomInstallationRemarks> provides learning metadata about how to install and needed resources.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomOtherPlatformRequirements
element.documentation: The <lomOtherPlatformRequirements> provides learning metadata information about other software and hardware requirements.

body.p: The <lomOtherPlatformRequirements> provides learning metadata information about other software and hardware requirements.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomInteractivityType
element.documentation: The <lomInteractivityType> provides learning metadata about the the type of interactivity supported by the resource.

body.p: The <lomInteractivityType> provides learning metadata about the the type of interactivity supported by the resource.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomLearningResourceType
element.documentation: The <lomLearningResourceType> provides learning metadata about the specific kind of resource used, most dominant kind first.

body.p: The <lomLearningResourceType> provides learning metadata about the specific kind of resource used, most dominant kind first.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomInteractivityLevel
element.documentation: The <lomInteractivityLevel> provides learning metadata about the level of interactivity between an end user and the learning object.

body.p: The <lomInteractivityLevel> provides learning metadata about the level of interactivity between an end user and the learning object.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomSemanticDensity
element.documentation: The <lomSemanticDensity> provides learning metadata about a subjective measure of the learning object's usefulness as compared to its size or duration.

body.p: The <lomSemanticDensity> provides learning metadata about a subjective measure of the learning object's usefulness as compared to its size or duration.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomIntendedUserRole
element.documentation: The <lomIntendedUserRole> provides learning metadata about the normal user of the resource, most dominant first.

body.p: The <lomIntendedUserRole> provides learning metadata about the normal user of the resource, most dominant first.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomContext
element.documentation: The <lomContext> provides learning metadata about the typical learning environment where use of learning object is intended to take place.

body.p: The <lomContext> describes the typical learning environment where use of the learning object is intended to take place.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomTypicalAgeRange
element.documentation: The <lomTypicalAgeRange> provides learning metadata about the age of the typical intended user.

body.p: The <lomTypicalAgeRange> provides learning metadata about the age of the typical intended user.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomDifficulty
element.documentation: The <lomDifficulty> provides learning metadata about how hard it is to work through the resource for the typical target audience.

body.p: The <lomDifficulty> provides learning metadata about how hard it is to work through the resource for the typical target audience.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements

element.name: lomTypicalLearningTime
element.documentation: The <lomTypicalLearningTime> provides learning metadata about the approximate or typical time it takes to work with the resource.

body.p: The <lomTypicalLearningTime> provides learning metadata about the approximate or typical time it takes to work with the resource.
Category: Learning and training: metadata elements
